item.title: Why Shift Left Matters in Security
item.description:
In the world of modern software development, speed is everything—but security can’t be an afterthought.
That’s where Shift Left Security comes in.

What is Shift Left?

“Shift Left” means integrating security earlier in the development lifecycle—right from design and coding. Instead of fixing vulnerabilities at the end (when it’s expensive and risky), we identify and eliminate them at the source.

Why Does It Matter?

  • 🕒 Time-Saving: Fixing bugs during coding is 10x cheaper than during production.
  • 🧠 Developer Awareness: Secure coding becomes a mindset, not a checklist.
  • 🔁 DevSecOps Friendly: Integrates seamlessly into CI/CD pipelines.

How I Apply It

In my projects, I build tools that analyze source code, offer secure coding guidelines, and plug directly into developer workflows. This reduces back-and-forth with security teams and empowers developers to own security from the start.
